fields.summary: Allow subscription to a particular component, to receive notification messages for issues in that component

fields.description:
Currently charts have only one way of selecting the Start date: "Days Previously" (i.e. -NNd)
It would be best to specify Start/End dates of charts using the same two methods that are available for date fields in filters: Relative and Absolute
- eg in Advanced searching mode: "created >= -3w AND created <= 2010-08-17"
- eg in Simple searching mode: Picker for relative dates; Select absolute date

One of the related issues asks for a fixed Start date, and the other for an End date.
fields.summary: Charts should use the same Start/End date selectors as Filters

fields.description:
Currently all charts run from "days previously" to today.
I think it's important to allow selecting a specific End date, in order to be able to investigate execution in the middle of a project (not just its last part).
The related tasks ask for something similar.
fields.summary: Allow specification of interval (end date) for charts
Resizing a comment box while typing moves the text cursor to the end

fields.description: It would be nice if notifications had more fine grained controls as to what triggers them.  For example we have some custom fields that indicate that the issue has been reviewed by <some group>.  We'd like for state changes for this custom field to not trigger a notification.
fields.summary: Notifications should be more fine grained.

fields.description: I feel it would add more value to have the "Attached Files" sorted by "Date Attached"  Basically by chronological order and not alphabetically.
fields.summary: Attachment Sort order

fields.description: How to define resolution value per project instead apply to all projects?
fields.summary: How to define resolution value per project instead apply to all projects?

fields.description:
Under Mac OS X the default screenshot format is PNG, but when attached to an issue via the screenshot applet it's converted to a rather heavily-compressed JPEG.

It'd be nice if the screenshot applet kept the same format that was originally pasted into it, without converting anything or adding extra compression (even if it does this only for PNG and JPEG).
fields.summary: Screenshot applet should keep the format of pasted screenshots

fields.description:
One should be able to move portlets (with their configurations) between dashboards.

Real-world example is a case when one wants to extract some of the portlets to a separate dashboards. Currently the cost of reconfiguring the portlets cannot be avoided.
fields.summary: Moving portlets between dashboards

fields.description:
Here are the steps on how to reproduce this bug:
# Go to _Administration -> Global Settings -> Events_
# Add a new event - Custom Event using Issue Commented template
# Go to the project associated Notification Scheme and add a user inside the Custom Event
# Edit an inactive workflow and replace the post function value for Resolve Issue:
- Fire a Custom Event event that can be processed by the listeners.
5. Associate this Workflow Scheme to a project
6. Create a new issue and then click on Resolve Issue

The mail received was okay and as intended (using the Issue Commented template plus with the correct listener name). Please see attached screenshot ({{CustomEvent.jpg}}). The mail format was in Text. 

However, after switching to the mail format to *HTML*, then try to create a new issue and then click on Resolve Issue. During the Resolve Issue transition screen, no comment was added. The mail received will show you "Issue updated by" as per this screen shot ({{WithoutComment.jpg}}). 

On the other hand, creating a new issue and then click on Resolve Issue, add a comment during the Resolve Issue transition screen. The mail received will something like per this screen shot ({{WithComment.jpg}}). 

This is definitely a bug in HTML mail format.
fields.summary: Mails in HTML format will send out Issue Updated notification when the custom event is using Issue Commented template

fields.description:
# create a parent issue (test-1) with 2d estimated, assign to yourself
# add a subtask (test-2) on the parent issue with 1d estimated, assign to yourself
# add another subtask (test-3) with 1d estimated, assign to yourself, log the work in test-3 e.g 4h.

search with JQL : assignee = <yourself> AND timespent is empty
result test-1 and test-2 returned, it is inconsistent, subtasks are not considered part of the parent task for this JQL

suggestion : option to include or ignore subtasks in the JQL search, like what we have [here|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Logging+Work+on+an+Issue#LoggingWorkonanIssue-Abouttimetracking]
fields.summary: To have subtask time tracking aggregate with parent issue

fields.description:
I want to use JIRA Advanced Searches to help me filter some issues without "\[Reviewed \- By \- Manager\]" in comment. But in the following url,JIRA seems can't filter issue just without a defined phrase,if we want to filter a issue without a phrase,we must provide a phrase which included in the comment.Such as,"Issue caused" NOT "\[Reviewed \- By \- Manager\]".I can't understand this kind of logic.Can you help us implement this?
http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.12/querysyntax.html?clicked=jirahelp
fields.summary: How to filter issues without a defined phrase

fields.description:
onStart() is only called after the plugin framework is initialised if JiraUtils.isSetup() returns true, which occurs after JIRA has been "set up" by a user (i.e. home dir specified, admin user created etc.)

This is a problem for plugins present the first time a JIRA instance is started (e.g. bundled plugins such as the JIRA FishEye plugin) that use onStart() to perform post load initialisation.

Moved from https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/SAL-78
fields.summary: LifecycleAware clients don't have onStart() called if JIRA is not setup
'Create issue' should take user back to previous screen after clicking 'Cancel'
RPC Services with getHistory/getActivity

fields.description:
Doco's listed [Connecting JIRA to a Database page|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+JIRA+to+a+Database] don't mention maxActive. This attribute is set in JIRA standalone to 20 - maxActive="20"

{code:xml}
        <Context path="" docBase="${catalina.home}/atlassian-jira" reloadable="false" useHttpOnly="true">
          <Resource name="jdbc/JiraDS" auth="Container" type="javax.sql.DataSource"
                    driverClassName="org.hsqldb.jdbcDriver"
                    url="jdbc:hsqldb:${catalina.home}/database/jiradb"
                    username="sa"
                    password=""
                    minEvictableIdleTimeMillis="4000"
                    timeBetweenEvictionRunsMillis="5000"
                    maxActive="20"
                  />
{code}

If maxActive is not set it uses the default number of the connections (8), which may be too little and can cause some performance issues.
fields.summary: Example maxActive needs to be mentioned on database integraton pages

fields.description: the "setting JAVA_HOME on Windows" link that points to http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Set+JAVA_HOME+variable+in+Windows is broken (and the suggested renamed page CAC links to starts by saying it is for Confluence only)
fields.summary: Broken link in README

fields.description: When initially installing JIRA with the installer, could launch JIRA with the option at the end. But then when trying to start again later, couldn't for several reasons, one of which being there was no JAVA_HOME defined. But shouldn't the installer have defined this? And how did it work at all initially? Not sure if this is related to JRA-22049 at all.
fields.summary: Installer runs JIRA non-sustainably

fields.description: When running the Windows installer on Windows 7, the default JIRA home directory is within Program Files, but the user doesn't have permission to that directory. (Now supposed to use some special application data directory for things like that.) So then when the user tries to start up JIRA after the install, it fails with a message about not being able to lock JIRA.
fields.summary: Users do not have permission to default JIRA home created when using installer

fields.description:
The upgrade guide for the [alternative upgrade method|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Alternative+method+of+upgrading+JIRA] is missing context since separation of the upgrade guide into two pages. The original form of the page is still available for the 4.0 release

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA040/Upgrading+JIRA

Since some of the steps for this method are similar to the [XML backup restore method|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Upgrading+JIRA] we should ensure that they are mentioned for the alternative method too.

We have noticed that since this change some of the customers are missing important steps while upgrading their system. Therefore it is important that we review this pages before the 4.2 release will come alive.
fields.summary: Alternative upgrade method doco is important steps

fields.description: If an user is a project administrator, he can also see the message recommending a re-indexing to be performed. Once this user is not a JIRA administrator, he cannot do what the message asks for and it gets a confusing situation. For this reason, this message should only be displayed to JIRA administrators.
fields.summary: Do not show the recommendation to perform a re-index to non JIRA administrators

fields.description: For some reason the comment box in JIRA 4.1.2 is not longer configurable. Please see the attached screenshot's for more information.
fields.summary: The comment field is not big enough

fields.description: The user is unable to attach screenshots using Attach a screenshot link
fields.summary: Unable to attach a screenshot

fields.description: When a gadget returns no issues, it is not possible to access the filter directly.  In JIRA 3.x you could click a link to go to the filter, even though no issues were returned.  A link is provided to the filter is issues are returned.
fields.summary: Cannot access filter with no results from gadget

fields.description:
Expanding content of a multi user field by clicking "<<<" symbol makes the entries disappear in IE8 (8.0.7600.16385).


Step to reproduce:

# Create one multi user picker field (CC) and associate it to a project.
# Create a issue, in CC field, Add more than 2 to 3 user in the CC (to make the CC field to expand and showing number)
# The CC field will show normally. Click on the arrows "<<<" to collapse it. The entire content of the CC field will disappear.
|

Screen Shot:
Before
!IE8 before.png!

After
!IE8 after.png!




Tested on JIRA 4.0.2 , JIRA 4.1.1 and JIRA 4.1.2, only happen in JIRA 4.1.2 with IE 8 without compatibility mode.

Workaround:
# Use compatibility view mode
# Use other browser such as Firefox.
fields.summary: Expanding content of a multi user field (CC field) by clicking "..." makes the entries disappear in IE8
Sort versions by the order configured on the Manage Versions page instead of their ID

fields.description:
If the developer evaluates and enters the due dates for all tasks which are assigned to him. Once the due date of one task has been changed, the other ones also need to be adjusted accordingly. But JIRA cannot do that.
In MS Project, if we set the sequence for the tasks, it can be implemented automatically.
I believe it's really useful for lots of company, is there any chance you could implement it?
fields.summary: Auto update the due dates

fields.description:
In each release, we have several milestones such as new request cutoff date, customer issue cutoff date, soft freeze, hard freeze, and etc. 
In JIRA, only release date can be set as a milestone.
Dear Atlassian team, can you help me about this?
fields.summary: Multi Milestones
PNG or GIF files with & character are accepted without an error message but do not display

fields.description:
When attaching a file with a file name, which uses special character, this file name is wrong in the new add  attachment dialog in JIRA 4.2 EAP. 

Instead of "C.\ONGRTLNS.W95" is says "ONGRTLNS.W95".

I am using MacOS X 10.6.3 with Firefox 3.6.8 (german).
fields.summary: Wrong file name in JIRA 4.2 add attachment dialog
Improve selecting reporter and assignee

fields.description:
I'm the Project Lead on the PSR Project that I requested to be created.

I have attachments on Jiras under the PSR Project that I need to delete.

How do I delete them, or is there a permissions issue that needs to be addressed?
fields.summary: Need to be able to delete attachments under the PSR Project

fields.description:
Text search seems to be limited to the summary, description, comments and environment fields.
It would be great if we could configure this search to include more standard fields and also custom fields.
fields.summary: Support quick text search for custom fields

fields.description:
After a fresh 4.1.2 install with no projects added, going to the user profile summary tab for a normal user (in jira-users) causes an exception that is shown on the web UI. An example from the logs:
{noformat}
2010-08-13 10:59:17,668 http-8080-2 ERROR testuser 659x276x1 1u9a8pf 128.214.71.243 /secure/ViewProfile.jspa [velocity] Method getFragmentHtml threw exception for reference $activityStreamFrag in template templates/plugins/userprofile/summary-panel.vm at  [43,13]
2010-08-13 10:59:17,669 http-8080-2 ERROR testuser 659x276x1 1u9a8pf 128.214.71.243 /secure/ViewProfile.jspa [com.atlassian.velocity.DefaultVelocityManager] MethodInvocationException occurred getting message body from Velocity: com.atlassian.gadgets.GadgetParsingException: org.apache.shindig.gadgets.GadgetException: Unable to retrieve gadget xml. HTTP error 504
        at com.atlassian.gadgets.renderer.internal.GadgetSpecFactoryImpl.getGadgetSpec(GadgetSpecFactoryImpl.java:151)
        at com.atlassian.gadgets.renderer.internal.GadgetSpecFactoryImpl.getGadgetSpec(GadgetSpecFactoryImpl.java:68)
        at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor166.invoke(Unknown Source)
        at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
{noformat}

... and so on.

The summary screen renders normally when the user is in group jira-administrators even with no projects in the system.

When even a single project is added to the system (seems there is no need even to add the user to the project) the summary tab renders correctly. When the project is removed, the error is back again.

This is not a big issue since a real JIRA instance will necessarily have one or more projects in use, but in case this is reproduceable in other systems, it would be wise to have JIRA fail gracefully and show some kind of informative message so it wouldn't be necessary to start troubleshooting in the implementation phase.
fields.summary: Rendering user profile summary causes an exception with non-admin users when there are no projects in JIRA

fields.description:
Steps:

1. Go to an issue.
2. Click on "Resolve Issue".
3. Change the fix version field so that two values are selected e.g.("4.2" and "4.2 - Beta").
4. Read the notification email.
5 *[BUG]* Notice that in the email you will only see the first value you selected in the fix version/s field.
fields.summary: If you add 2 fix versions when resolving an issue the notification email will only tell you about the the first fix version

fields.description:
If a group with null name is created,there will be exception when select groups for a project members.
Sorry for my poor english.
fields.summary: No validation on creating user group,

fields.description: I would like it if either the cause of a build being kicked off read "Started by an SCM change by dhackner" or at least showed the committer name next to Changes (instead of requiring a click on details).
fields.summary: Change the "Started by an SCM change" text to contain information about who committed the change

fields.description: There is a visible nbsp between 'Projet' and the colon on the Administration menu of the french language interface.
fields.summary: nbsp in Administration menu of french language interface

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-22026].
  {panel}

I want to be able to create an issue through the email service. The problem is that we currently have 20 projects and 8 issue states which would require me to create 160 email addresses, mail servers, and mail services. This I suppose is a work around to the issue except that the support for this is impossible so I consider a non-starter solution. I sent in a support request dealing with this issue:

https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-62775?page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:all-tabpanel

I looked at both solutions, but the advanced mail handler plug in isn't 4.1 complaint. I will have to create a specialized mail handler but it seems to me that you can already read the issue from the subject since I can use this to comment on existing issues even without any defaults in the handler parameters. I would think it would be possible and very easy since most of the architecture is already set up to overwrite the project and issuetype in the subject of the email. Basically I want to mail something to the email address set up in a service where the subject line would be something like:

project=RM, issuetype=8, issuename=Testing Email Issue Creation for Project RM

and body:

Testing the creating of an issue under project RM.

Which would create a new issue with type 8 under the project RM with an initial comment of "Testing the creating of an issue under project RM."
fields.summary: Allow overwriting mail handler parameters in subject line of email

fields.description:
Hi guys re Rapotr Ticket P07349976 


I am looking to streamline the trade booking/enrichment process and am looking to find out if the below enhancements could be made to Nemesis.


Firstly, could the customer account for manual eurex futures be auto-populated with 098612666 whenever a trade is booked?


Also, when basis trades are booked using the !b feature, would it be possible for you to add in a feature that populates the futures short code too? I would be happy to send you a list of the short codes for futures that correspond to the bond short codes.


I realise this may take some time to implement on your side but I am happy to help in any way I can to get these fixes in place.


thanks as always
Gregg Allan
fields.summary: NEMESIS streamline the trade booking/enrichment process the  manual eurex futures

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-22024].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 23 April 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your input in the comments helps us understand how this affects you and what you're hoping to accomplish with JIRA.

At this time, this suggestion is not on the JIRA development roadmap. Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Dave Meyer
[dmeyer@atlassian.com|mailto:dmeyer@atlassian.com]
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

It seems that there is no way (or none that I'm aware of) how to search for issues that are blocked by unresolved issues, resolved issues or not blocked by other unresolved issues at all (to see which issues I can work on). That would be really useful feature, because now I can have saved search filter with issues assigned to me, but I have to go through them one by one to see which are not blocked by any other. Also, it's useful to see which issues are blocking others, because we usually want them to be done first.
I found a "linkedissues" function but that can refer to only one issue.
fields.summary: Ability to search for blocked / blocking issues
JIRA Gadget response is unhelpful and ugly if you have a "Malformed security token"

fields.description: See attached screenshot.

fields.description:
{quote}
4:58:14 PM Erik van Zijst: by default JIRA (and possibly confluence?) have some presets for URL patterns
4:58:22 PM Erik van Zijst: however, these do not include soap
4:58:51 PM Erik van Zijst: so, with the default settings, fecru -> jira integration is fail because it relies on soap
4:59:52 PM David O'Flynn: So, what we would like from the JIRA team is for 4.2 to change the URL paths for Trusted Apps to include SOAP?
5:00:10 PM Erik van Zijst: yeah, that'd be great
5:01:01 PM Erik van Zijst: oh, and : /rest/gadget/1.0/currentUser
{quote}
fields.summary: Add SOAP URLs to the default Trusted Apps patterns

fields.description:
*Steps needed to reproduce this problem:*

# Create a custom filed 'Multi User Picker' type.
# Add it to default screen.
# Edit/create issue and provide a few users in the custom field e.g 6.
# When issue viewed in IE8, the custom field display blank content.


!cf_ie8.png|thumbnail!

The same issue is viewed correctly in Compatibility View in IE8 

!cf_ie8_comp.png|thumbnail!

*Workaround:*
Problem is not observed in Firefox nor Compatibility View
fields.summary: Content Multi User Picker custom field type not displayed in IE8

fields.description: Short Cut Help Screen Occasionally comes up Garbled  - difficult to recreate but seems to happen more when the system is busy.
fields.summary: Short Cut Help Screen Occasionally comes up Garbled

fields.description:
Occasional strange behavior in issue navigator.  Using mouse to navigate, click on a line items Action and Operations dropdown - wait for the drop down to appear and then jump to another line items Action and Operations dropdown and click on View.  Occasionally I am getting a prompt to save the file instead of taking me to issues details

only in firefox - i can not reproduce in IE.
fields.summary: View Issue from Action and Operations menu sometimes prompts to download file in Firefox

fields.description:
From issue navigator the only shortcut that seems to work consistently is Operations Dialog.

I am having problems with e - Edit, a - Assign, m - Comment, and l - Labels

All operations seem ok from the issue screen.
fields.summary: Issue Action shortcuts aren't working consistently from the Issue Navigator

fields.description: When bulk changing multiple tickets I am unable to change Fix Version, Affects Version or Components.  I would expect the new "label like" handling of these 2 fields as when editing a single issue.
fields.summary: Version and Component Fields not editable during Bulk Change

fields.description:
If you create a Custom field "X" that is constrained by Issue Type "A" and add the custom field "X" as a column on the Issue Navigator the custom field "X" will not show up in the issue navigator unless you apply the proper filters on the issue type.

Conditions to replicate the problem:

* Have a Project "P" and all issues in this project are Issue Type "A". 

* Perform the following search: *project = "P"*

You will see that custom field "X" does not show up in the issue navigator.

* Perform the following search: *project = "P" AND issue type = "A"* 

You will see that custom field "X" shows up in the issue navigator.
fields.summary: Custom Field constrained by issue type

fields.description:
For some reason, "sandbox.onjira.com" worked fine for last few days, but I start to receive strings in raw data.   For example, if you look up "TST-518", you'll get the followings in response object:


RemoteIssue{affectsVersions=[]; assignee=String{bytes=anNsb2F0; empty=false; }; attachmentNames=[]; components=[]; created=2010-08-11T15:53:06.701Z; customFieldValues=[RemoteCustomFieldValue{customfieldId=String{bytes=Y3VzdG9tZmllbGRfMTAwMTA=; empty=false; }; key=null; values=[String{bytes=base64Binary{}; empty=true; }]; }]; description=String{bytes=T0s/; empty=false; }; duedate=null; environment=null; fixVersions=[]; id=String{bytes=MTE5ODA=; empty=false; }; key=String{bytes=VFNULTUxOA==; empty=false; }; priority=String{bytes=Mw==; empty=false; }; project=String{bytes=VFNU; empty=false; }; reporter=String{bytes=amlyYW5hdG9y; empty=false; }; resolution=null; status=String{bytes=MQ==; empty=false; }; summary=String{bytes=Zmlyc3QgcnVu; empty=false; }; type=String{bytes=Mw==; empty=false; }; updated=2010-08-11T15:53:06.701Z; votes=0; }



Thanks.
-Chunyen
fields.summary: response in raw data?

fields.description: A record in the Jira Project (Cust COM) was inadvertently set to the Duplicate state.  I do not see a way for me as the project admin to set it back.  Can someone please help me to set it back to the Submitted state?
fields.summary: How to change from Duplicate state

fields.description:
{code}
http://localhost:8080/secure/project/AvatarPicker!upload.jspa [500ErrorPage.jsp] Exception caught in 500 page Unexpected block type 0!
javax.imageio.IIOException: Unexpected block type 0!
	at com.sun.imageio.plugins.gif.GIFImageReader.readMetadata(GIFImageReader.java:722)
	at com.sun.imageio.plugins.gif.GIFImageReader.read(GIFImageReader.java:794)
	at javax.imageio.ImageIO.read(ImageIO.java:1422)
	at javax.imageio.ImageIO.read(ImageIO.java:1282)
	at com.atlassian.core.util.thumbnail.Thumber.getImage(Thumber.java:270)
{code}

Some GIF files trigger this bug.
I found a bug report of this error on SUN Bug Database: http://bugs.sun.com/bugdatabase/view_bug.do?bug_id=6358674

As this is a know bug of Java (since 2005 according to SUN Bug Database), *JIRA could better handle this exception and show a more graceful message instead of exploding an exception on the screen!*

I'm also attaching a GIF file that triggers the exception.

h2. Workaround
Convert the GIF file to another format like JPEG or PNG.
fields.summary: Exception is thrown when trying to upload GIF file as Avatar
Notification scheme event Issue Moved should be able to notify owner of the project the issue is being moved into.

fields.description:
A have observed that email-threads has been copied into the comments of an issue. The thread was relevant to the issue, but the connection was lose, so it replacing the mail thread with comments was not possible.

Saving the thread as a .msg file and upload it would work to document, but viewing it will then require more effort.

A solution to this could be the possibilty of a view functions. One click on the .msg attachment will bring up a window displaying the email. This is similar to the preview of images, or the possibility to view files inside an uploaded zip file.
fields.summary: Email files - like Outlook .msg files - that are uploaded as attachement can be viewed

fields.description:
While opening an attachment in JIRA, by clicking at one of these thumbnails I get the ajax loading animation and it tries to load the image. The next thing was an error message popup saying:
- *The image is not available. It may have been deleted by another user*

As of now, it happens intermittently and randomly. After closing it and then clicking the same image for the second time, the image appears successfully.
fields.summary: While opening an image throws this error - The image is not available. It may have been deleted by another user

fields.description:
We are currently rewriting Workflow Post Function which are either creating new issues or updating related issues based on values from the transition screen using the new IssueService.

Scenario:
2 fields on the transition screen (which are also part of the normal edit screen for the current issue)
- System Field: Summary
- Custom Field: Free Text Field

field values before transition:
- Summary: 'foobar'
- Free Text Field: 'whatever'

field entered on transiton screen:
- Summary: 'test 1'
- Free Text Field: 'should change'


during the workflow postfunction we use the following to access this fields:
Map<Object,Object> fieldValuesHolder = new HashMap<Object, Object>();
summarySystemField.populateFromIssue(fieldValuesHolder, issue);
freeTextField.populateFromIssue(fieldValuesHolder, issue);

the values in the fieldValuesHolder are as follow:
- Summary: 'test 1'
- Free Text Field: 'whatever'

for the system field 'summary' we got the updated value from the transition screen, but not for the custom field... in this case we get the value before the transition.
fields.summary: inconsistant behaviour using OrderableField.populateFromIssue() on System Fields and CustomFields in Workflow Post Function if Field is updated in Workflow Transition

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-22004].
  {panel}

We have a custom field 'git repository' that we use on all tickets. My team is only concerned with tickets in the 'xx' repository (other repositories include 'xx-ops', 'xx-blah', 'phoenix'). Currently there is no way for us to ask for tickets with exactly 'xx' in the 'git repository' field (we end up getting tickets in xx-ops and xx-blah in addition).

Please allow the ==/= operator on text fields... it seems trivial to implement at the SQL layer.

Thanks,
Andy
fields.summary: allow non-fuzzy/equality text searching
Gadgets display an unuseful error message if you haven't done the oauth dance

fields.description:
Can we please improve the GreenHopper installation guide to include allocating an extra 256M or RAM to JIRA just for GreenHopper. 

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/GreenHopper+Installation+and+Upgrade+Guide

That message can either be placed in the installation steps or anywhere else in the guide. We have lots of issues where clients install the plugin with only 256M of RAM allocated to JIRA instead of a minimum of 512M of RAM which is required. This causes them to encounter out of memory or performance errors. You can reference this link on how to allocate more memory:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Increasing+JIRA+Memory
fields.summary: Improve Greenhopper install documentation

fields.description:
I have entered a test bug in jira.atlassian.com (TST-22611). When searching for "coupon" or "sa_coupon" this issue is found. But when I search for "sa_coupon_check" it is not found.

I tried searching from the Navigator, from the quick search and from the JQL window, always with the same results.

Customer reports this bug occurs only in JIRA 4.1.1 and 4.1.2, not in earlier releases.
fields.summary: search engine does not find summary string
Extend maximum days for "Created vs Resolved Issues Report"

fields.description:
Ever since the 'Resolved Date' was added to JIRA it is set every time there is a workflow transition using a workflow transition screen that contains the field.

This is a pretty big problem for project reporting.

Most workflows have some kind of 'Verify' state after the 'In Progress', or 'Working' state. When QA goes to qa and close the issue often the 'resolution screen' is used even though the resolution, often times, is already set. Using the 'resolution screen' a second time during the workflow is common and allows QA to decide and mark the bug as unfixable, won't fix, cannot reproduce, etc.

Previously, with 'Resolution Date', the field would only change values when the value was set initially or changed.

Now the value is being reset every time a transition form displays the field, even if it isn't changed. 

I marked this as critical because there are lots of issues that aren't closed until long after they are resolved - resetting the resolution, or resolved date, every time the field is shown is wrong.

*Steps to Replicate*
# Create a workflow using 'open', 'verify' and 'closed' statuses
# On the transition from open to verify use the 'resolved issue screen' as the transition form
# On the transition from verify to closed use the 'resolved issue screen' as the transition form
# Create an issue
# Transition it to verify, set the resolution
# Note the date/time of the resolved date
# Wait 5 minutes (or just one, depending on your patience level)
# Transition from verify to closed, not touching the resolution
# Note the *'new'* date/time for the resolved date. This shouldn't happen
fields.summary: Resolved Date/Time is reset every time a transition screen shows the field
Show who will be assigned if "- Automatic - " is selected in the assignee field

fields.description: It should be possible to resize the panel on the left side of the issue navigator. Then you could read the complete history entries or completely collapse the panel to maximize the space available for displaying the issues.
fields.summary: Make it possible to resize the panel on the left side

Option to make certain accounts immune to captcha-after-X-failed-logins

fields.description:
Greetings.

Per [JSP-62458|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-62458], user reported problem that I can reproduce with vanilla data, etc.

Steps to reproduce:

1. Create or find a Dashboard.

2. Load 'Recently Created' gadget. Set period to 1 month, interval at 1 day.

3. Go to Dashboard, click 'maximize' on said gadget to display tabular data.

4. Click the 'Total Issues' link to see view in Issue Navigator.

5. Click browser's 'Back' button.

6. Note the truncated iframe, apparently by the parent structures. 

Attached is my vanilla data with example dashboard/gadget test for your amusement.

Please let me know if you have further questions or concerns.

Be well,

Jason Hammons
Support Engineer - San Francisco
fields.summary: Recently Created gadget visually truncated tabular data after 'Back' from Issue Navigator

fields.description: In our environment, anyone may clone an issue to save time re-typing.  If the current user is different than the original reporter, JIRA reports that the original reporter created the issue.  This does not represent our workflow - should allow us to have the new bug default to being reported by the current user.
fields.summary: Allow cloned issues to be current user

fields.description:
Currently a JQL search on something like:
project = CQM AND fixVersion = "2.2"

Throws a 'query is too complex' error because we have more than one project with version 2.2.
It seems you shouldn't have to look up internal IDs in the system to execute a simple query like this.

Also users now are forced to jump into advanced query mode and look up internal IDs of versions so it appears to users that the system has regressed in usability.  

We can't be the only people who have projects with version numbering that runs parallel in different projects.
 
It seems like this could be fixed by grouping results by project.
fields.summary: Some searches on project + version combinations erroneously send users to the Advanced Search page with a  'query is too complex' exception
Edit labels action in the issue navigator on an issue often results in a dialog box filled with gibberish

fields.description:
When viewing the user statistics, the last login is really showing the last login into JIRA.
However when a user had checked the "remember login", the last login is not updated for the next access to JIRA
fields.summary: Last login not updated when "remember my login" checked

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-21981].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
JIRA Cloud Supports Google Apps Integration

h3. Suggested Solution
Have a similar feature in JIRA Server products to allow integration with Google Apps Directly. 
 
h3. Workaround

Some suggestions are as below:
# Migrate the Instance to Atlassian Cloud [Migrating from JIRA Server to JIRA Cloud|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CLOUDKB/Migrating+from+JIRA+Server+to+JIRA+Cloud]. 
# Use a Third Party Plugin from the [Atlassian Marketplace|https://marketplace.atlassian.com] such as [OpenID Authentication for JIRA|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.pawelniewiadomski.jira.jira-openid-authentication-plugin/server/overview]
# Use [Atlassian Crowd|https://www.atlassian.com/software/crowd/overview/], and then integrate with Google ID as per the documentation: [Configuring the Google Apps Connector|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CROWD/Configuring+the+Google+Apps+Connector]

h3. Original Request
JIRA Studio- OnDemand-style Google Apps integration for JIRA Standalone would be cool, particularly the Activity Bar and the ability to attach/preview Google Docs.
fields.summary: Google Apps integration for JIRA Standalone

fields.description:
Hello,

With screen resolution of 1024x768 pixels, the Date Picker field name overlaps, probably when the field name is too long.
This problem does not occur in Firefox, only with Internet Explorer 7.
There is no VM screen customizations.
See the image attached for more details.

Please contact me if you need further information.

Thanks,
____________________
Felipe Kraemer
Atlassian Support
fields.summary: IE7 Layout Overlaps With Date Picker
To prevent spam and loss of privacy, warn on Sign Up that usernames are public

fields.description:
Hello,

We upgraded to JIRA this week and the most common complaint I have had (and I tend to agree with them) is that the current Issue view has way too much white space. In the previous versions there was more of a delineation between each field and its value whereas now the fields are all blended on the white background without and kind of break between the fields. The light grey Label headings also don't help make it easy to read.

The feature I think everyone wants is to have some shades from field to field. This will make it easier to read.

Also is there anyway that you can make the lines customizable like you do on the header and Menu bar?
fields.summary: The Current JIRA Layout has too Much White Space and it makes it hard to read

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-21974].
  {panel}

In JIRA 4, we have advanced capabilities for querying, but they still don't solve this need for us

# the JQL contains (~) operator doesn't work with Reported in Release or the other release fields, because it cannot search the labels for the enumerated values in the pulldowns - the contains operator only works on text fields
# the JQL < and > operators do work, but they return essentially "higher or lower in the select list than the specified value", not "all releases in a particular branch" or "earlier or later releases of this code branch", and its unclear how they handle new entries added at the end or in the middle of the selection list.

The ideal situation would be if the contains operator "did what I mean", facilitating queries like:

"Fix Version" ~ "HF" to find all issues fixed in a hotfix release (HF 1, HF2, etc)
"Reported in Release" ~ "9.0" to find all issues reported against any build of 9.0 (9.0.x, 9.0.32.2,etc)

Is there a workaround we could use or is this currently not supported by JQL?  This feature would allow us to create dynamic filters instead of adding new options to the filter each time options are added to the field we want to search on.
fields.summary: Contains search on select list field using JQL

fields.description: I would like to change the owner of my filters and/or have group ownership. Currently, if I create a filter, I am the only person that can edit the filter. I would like for other to be able to edit some of my filters.
fields.summary: I would like to change the owner of my filters and/or have group ownership

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-21970].
  {panel}

Having lots of versions on the Manage version page makes the Scheduling dropdown long. 

We use greenhopper and has a released version named 'no sprint' with no release date for collecting duplicates and other triage activities (making it the top released version in other lists). 

To add a new release you have to open the scheduling dropdown. The scheduling dropdown has the last item as its default, which our 'no sprint' version occupies. 
So we need to scroll down to the (almost) bottom to get to the right version.  
This takes time because the sort order on the scheduling dropdown is oldest at top and newest version is at the bottom.

Reversing the order would make the interaction much faster since the right version would be the first item (or in our case, the second) and no scrolling would be required.

ps.
don't forget to change the default value to the top item
.ds
fields.summary: order of schdule's dropdown items should be the same as in the table on the Manage versions page

fields.description:
unable to update translated text as it will be overwrite with default English text.
e.g default language = English (United States), translated language = Chinese (China)
fields.summary: Language translation for issue settings - issue types, Priorities, Resolutions, Statuses

fields.description: The Road Map screen under 'Projects' could do with different coloured rows under each version, to improve readability.
fields.summary: The Road Map screen under 'Projects' could do with different coloured rows under each version, to improve readability.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-21965].
{panel}
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 23 April 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

There is an add-on from Atlassian Labs that provides a rich text dashboard gadget for JIRA Cloud. You can find it by searching for "rich text gadget" in the Find New Add-ons page on your JIRA Cloud instance or [getting it from the Atlassian Marketplace|https://slack.atlassian.io/atlassian-connect.json].

This add-on is not officially supported by Atlassian.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Dave Meyer
 [dmeyer@atlassian.com|mailto:dmeyer@atlassian.com]
{panel}
The text gadget can make JIRA vulnerable to XSS attacks because it allows arbitrary html, which is why it is disabled by default.

A wiki rendering replacement could cater to the needs of an arbitrary html gadget without the danger. Custom html could still be added to the wiki gadget where required through the creation of macro plugins for JIRA's wiki renderer.
fields.summary: Replace unsafe text gadget and add to JIRA Cloud

fields.description: When you are working on a ticket, if you are down below where the comments are, you have to come all the way up to access the main menu. If you have to access the main menu often, this gets to be very annoying. There should be a way to lock down the menu header.
fields.summary: Lock down the menu header

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-21962].
  {panel}

We upgraded to the latest version of JIRA and while the Avatar function is nice it has brought up a concern.

See details of concern in your support system under this issue (https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-62383)

In particular I have the problem that I have a number of people that can administer projects and I have had the problem that some employee uploaded inappropriate pictures as an avatar.

While this seems like a minor inconvenience, it opens up our company to complaints from employees.

We think you need to add the ability to TURN OFF the avatar function in order to reduce this exposure.
fields.summary: Provide the Ability to Turn Off Avatar's

fields.description:
It's not possible to order sub-tasks in IE7.

The little arrows that should appear when you mouse over a sub-task do not appear.
This bug is reproducible.

I tested in IE6 and IE8 also. In this cases, ordering sub-task works perfectly.

!ie6.png!
!ie8.png!
!ie7.png!
fields.summary: It's not possible to order sub-tasks in IE7

fields.description:
I create my own filter and want to share it with somebody via instant messenger by giving a link (it works)
http://example.com/jira/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?mode=hide&requestId=10060

But when I sort the issues the link removes the requestId parameter:
http://example.com/jira/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?sorter/field=status&sorter/order=DESC
fields.summary: Sorting issues removes the requestId parameter from the URL
Enable auto-response from email-based issue creation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-21958].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 13 Jan 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your feedback is key to helping us understand how you use JIRA so we can continue improving your experience. We have reviewed this issue over the last few days; however there are no immediate plans to put this suggestion on our near term roadmap.

Please consider using the [SSL for JIRA|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.plugin.jirasslplugin/server/overview] add-on from the Atlassian Marketplace.

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Daniel Franz
dfranz@atlassian.com
Principal Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}
  

Adding a cert to the keystore is a somewhat painful process. A browser does this automatically. There's a blog from [sun|http://blogs.sun.com/andreas/entry/no_more_unable_to_find] with a utility that does this programatically. It'd be nice to add an SSL cert to the keystore programatically through JIRA, or better yet a cross-product library.
fields.summary: Add automatic detection of SSL subscriptions

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 6 Aug 2010|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA} 
Update - [feedback.onjira.com|http://feedback.onjira.com] has been upgraded again, please re-confirm your issue and let us know of the result.

Hi all,

The upgrade of feedback.onjira.com was incomplete and we are investigating the root cause of this.
We know this because some issues raised such as this one can not be reproduced on our internal test instance.

Once we upgrade feedback.onjira.com to a satisfactory state we will update this Atlassian status box.
We will also update this issue's status.

We apologise for the inconvenience and we thank you for raising these issues.

Cheers,

Roy Krishna
JIRA Product Manager
{panel}

When you click the "+" next to time tracking and add time, and click "Log", the page does not give you any feedback that time was successfully logged.  No message at the top, the Time Tracking info section doesn't update, nothing.  You have to manually refresh the page to see the time was applied.

Furthermore, if you do something to the issue (like start to add a comment but don't submit) and then open the Log Time dialog but click *Cancel*, you get a warning about leaving the current page.  So basically the Log Work dialog refreshes the page if you click Cancel, but doesn't refresh the page if you actually log time.  Seems backwards.
fields.summary: Logging time doesn't reload the page or refresh the time tracking section

When you are viewing the Issue Navigator, if you click the Actions Drop down (little gear) you get the menu.  Click it again, it closes.  Now click it again, and it will flash up but then disappear and all you will see is the spinning ticker. Click again, and it disappears.  Click again, and the menu appears again.  

Basically it seems like the menu appears on every other attempt, it appears, and then the spinning ticker, then it appears, then the spinning ticker, ...

This behavior does not happen on the Dashboard Gadget issue filters action dropdowns.  You can click those over and over and they correctly show, hide, show, hide, etc.  It just happens on the Issue Navigator.
fields.summary: Actions Dropdown in Issue Navigator doesn't show after multiple clicks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-21951].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 6 Aug 2010|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA} 
Update - [feedback.onjira.com|http://feedback.onjira.com] has been upgraded again, please re-confirm your issue and let us know of the result.

Hi all,

The upgrade of feedback.onjira.com was incomplete and we are investigating the root cause of this.
We know this because some issues raised such as this one can not be reproduced on our internal test instance.
We do understand you other UI points and will take them into consideration.

Once we upgrade feedback.onjira.com to a satisfactory state we will update this Atlassian status box.
We will also update this issue's status.

We apologise for the inconvenience and we thank you for raising these issues.

Cheers,

Roy Krishna
JIRA Product Manager
{panel}

Hallo

Thanks for providing me an account for http://feedback.onjira.com/

I've had a look at the main thing that I find disturbing: the view issue screen.

Compared to 4.1.2 it does look better. For someone who migrates from 4.0.2 the changes still don't feel natural.


The idea to keep action buttons and workflow actions on the screen while scrolling is nice! 
that scrolling mechanism has some drawbacks. in some cases the scrollbar appears that sort of kills the mouse-wheel
(see screenshot). to reproduce: scroll down on issue http://feedback.onjira.com/browse/BOX-1
and click on a lower sub-task menu (number 4 for ex). The view jumps and the additional scrollbar does not go away.


I dont like the buttons on top for actions and workflow. There is one rule I would recommend to follow: *make same things look the same!*
If some workflow actions are buttons and some are memnu-points, how do they differ? well they dont but one could think so.


There is also some white space below the work logs. I understand it is difficult to fill it. So I got a suggestion.


Move the work log inside the issue area (marked in green on the screenshot).
Then the width could be used in full for starting with the description. 
Also it might be an idea to make that area flippable, so it could be vertical or horizontal.

The vertical way would be more for people like me
The horizontal would be more for modern fashioned folks.


There are other things as well:
* you cheat the fix versions, affects versions and components information (marked in magenta) by cutting it
* marked in blue is more what i would like to see together (type, priority, assignee, status, as most important ones)
* comments are hovered on mouseover but one cannot click on them. coloring comments odd / even with a background would make a calmer layout and would avaoid additional lines to distinguish comments
* the breadcrumb navigation on top lacks the issue / sub-issue structure.
fields.summary: Feedback on Jira 4.2 EAP - View Issue Screen
